author: Michelle Hackman
title: Oklahoma Teachers Continue Walkout
text:
Thousands of Oklahoma teachers surrounded the state Capitol on Tuesday amid a statewide walkout that shuttered schools for a second day, with signs emerging that the two sides remained far apart and no indication the protest would end soon.
The teachers and their union representatives are demanding a $10,000 pay raise, saying the $6,000 average raise the stateâ€™s Republican governor, Mary Fallin, signed into law last week was insufficient after years without pay increases. Teachers are also demanding other restorations to education...
